title: Basic Agricultural Science (2013)
subject: CTAE: Agriculture, Food & Natural Resources Career Cluster (2013-)

document.title: Agriculture, Food & Natural Resources Career Cluster Basic Agriculture Science

93DD486B8EAA48329D505DED524C6488.description:
Analyze skills, education requirements, income, and advantages and disadvantages of
careers in the plant science industry.

techniques.

41B9C0757C464DCAB67FE6D23C4544AE.description: Debate the use of organic and inorganic fertilizers in plant production.

FE3DDD34318547229CC0531546603FDA.description: Explain the roles of essential plant nutrients for plant growth and reproduction.

importance.

75E0DAEABEC34A739624542B1657211F.description:

reproduction.

255D67F83CA343A0B0C6B3C7C2578725.description:
Analyzes skills, education requirements, income, and advantages and disadvantages of
careers in the agricultural environmental science industry.

9044E8A95DAA42FA96024A1905D6DCDB.description: Debates how environmental legislation effects agricultural production.

AEA29BB32BE842B9BA463B8AC1F73B8F.description:
Demonstrates how intensive production systems such as aquaculture and vertical farming
can maximize production while minimizing space requirements.

C304BB16A3B840E18F5559379AFE7AE3.description:
Compares and contrasts current production practices such as organic, naturally raised
systems, and conventional agricultural production with regard to their sustainability.

DE65A48225614C22B6709227B4EA1C95.description: Analyzes the efficiency of renewable energy sources such as wind, solar, and biofuels.

EEC0D5DB3A33440C902F5F7A6CEDB680.description: Identifies agricultural commodities that can be converted to alternative energy sources.

33481F20F99D474994A910572C8C6A12.description:
Apply principles of environmental science as it relates to agricultural production and
sustainability.

5FB06B5CD4D249F3BE58C79FFD86D251.description:
Analyzes skills, education requirements, income, and advantages and disadvantages of
careers in the food processing industry.

E5B6A5B67055410494A7F7FBA63B5FE5.description:
Demonstrate the processing, preserving, and packaging of foods using various methods
and techniques.

943058AEC0704FED927E3C64858F9F2C.description: Explain the importance of food processing, preserving, and packaging.

075E0E14FC3340CBAFA75E23501A38FF.description: Describe methods of food processing, preserving, and packaging.

947BE824F0C3473EAD2A5EEE96E21AEC.description:
Explore government requirements and government agencies associated with food quality
and food safety.

56EE20613D154A29B1D667784F7A5037.description: Assess the importance of developing and maintaining sanitation standards.

0AF4266E9206439B9B9000D19A8AC495.description:
Apply principles of science to food processing to provide a safe, wholesome and nutritious
food supply.

D8017D8794674BC2A40A0E92455AD19B.description:
Analyze skills, education requirements, income, and advantages and disadvantages of
careers in the forest and natural resources industry.

92063E6DA6E648A7BA0E4CB24AABEBE2.description: Compare and contrast approved practices in managing wildlife.

D93DFEE13F5D4C02ACC852B1FE6F5240.description: Explain the relationship between wildlife and the environment.

9F2A0B5AA1CD44669C2AFA2834F445CF.description: Identify important species of trees and wildlife in Georgia.

D7D08B1E138741CBA647CAD099588876.description: Identify basic equipment used in forestry.

C872362A6F2B4871AE37F89930610E05.description: Label various parts of trees and explain their functions.

054E67FB9F78493F9C42B15CF1B710ED.description: Describe the importance of the forestry and natural resource industry to Georgia's economy.

43C21EBD04A14A73B44DB26272E84B37.description: Demonstrate basic skills in natural resource management.

FF807CDBEDA84CC6A4AAE3B17F1C20F0.description: Provide for the care and welfare of animals.

CA29A6D9EB084DC79B287CFE20BE48BA.description:
Analyze skills, education requirements, income, and advantages and disadvantages of
careers in the animal industry and explain how they differ from traditional on-farm animal
husbandry.

D92CCC0D8619467CABCD8F1E14682B15.description:
Differentiate between major wholesale/retail meat cuts of beef, pork, lamb, and poultry and
compare the value of various meat cuts.

1EFE4C96CFC746BC89788AB0BC244CB5.description: Explain the basic anatomy and label basic external parts of production animals.

B9A34479475841D8B98887E735ABF7F0.description: Distinguish between animal welfare and animal rights.

1F93742FB10F4F8D9154373099D1C4F3.description: Define key terminology related to animal science and production practices (fact vs. fiction).

6A777648B1D342549B4554F31DB71109.description: Explore the importance of alternative livestock in animal agriculture.

3C47802094B647F89A14418631238A95.description: Identify and describe major breeds within each livestock segment.

D8BA724C9C59405DBB2DE273E3E3B114.description:
Analyze the role, importance, and scope of the dairy, beef, pork, poultry, equine, and small
ruminant animal industries in modern agriculture.

AEFF9F8BB1D04D06AEC755CA3DFD0C4A.description:
Define major components of the animal industry and outline the development of the
resulting products, services, and careers.

6D6649657BA0406AA81A3AF75DAF4E70.description:
Analyze skills, education requirements, income, and advantages and disadvantages of
careers in agriscience/biotechnology fields.

6A3D5BF821BB4F36AEB0310A6EF960B7.description: Research and report current agricultural biotechnology events or products.

1C02A8F3397346079B6774547FB08832.description:
Design, implement, collect data, and determine conclusions by conducting scientific
experiments in any field of agriculture.

13F2627DFB3F43E0A7E566AA6BFB13EF.description:
Explain the importance of the scientific method in agriculture and list examples of current
agriculture research.

CE7B16BB219549B9B29AEB4E9AAFC170.description: Define biotechnology and create a timeline of biotechnology milestones.

CF99D334EF28435483A806F3FD56886C.description:
Identify the different areas of agriscience and relate the scientific classification system to
organize and research the agriscience field.

5A27751337E4435F97A1AA09F515C7C3.description: Plan and construct basic Agricultural Mechanics project.

1AFEB257AE1D4F3A94A7811A2F609FBF.description:
Analyze skills, education requirements, income, and advantages and disadvantages of
careers in the agricultural mechanics industry.

A52EEB33E75943A1B0035F359D39780A.description:
Demonstrate safe operating instructions and procedures for a tractor or lawn equipment as
recommended by the manufacturer.

59CAE850E38F4681BE1E0239F31B2A3A.description:
Interpret service manuals to develop tractor or lawn mower maintenance calendars and
perform basic service and maintenance recommendations on a tractor or lawn mower.

BEF8F917B55E499EB4F9547918E9DD0B.description: Trace the development of agricultural machinery.

4E6345499C7343E1AE909A584F1B2677.description:
Analyze the use of thermal energy, electrical energy and compression in agriculture and
describe basic principles of each.

1FAFF4E2CF044599AEAA592D23B29560.description:
Explain the areas of physics used in agriscience as it relates to work, power, simple
machines and mechanical advantage.

577F406C77554BD99D7A31D8ED9E1EEA.description:
Demonstrate knowledge of physics used in agriculture as it relates to work, power, simple
machines, and both past and present machinery used in the agricultural industry.

E14E3C228F464478B2559D819FE51B7F.description:
Analyze skills, education requirements, income, and advantages and disadvantages of
careers in agronomy.

19544F1F82C44A228D3A08D9ED82E917.description: Determine land class on a given site and select appropriate soil management practices.

35A650B358C64FE28379F0903D381DC0.description:
Analyze the importance of slope, soil texture, erosion, and water movement in determining
land capability and land use.

7ACD71E73558439D917BA7B4B8341920.description: Explain the importance of soil ecosystems.

AB8BF4726F504E3EA9826A6F1DCB465C.description: Describe soil formation and soil composition.

5D4404173CF249C3A19416FB0ED1F84E.description:
Describe soil formation and management and assess its relevance to plant/animal
production and natural resources management.

CC2E4CB9ED7648E2AD3153CD78227815.description:
Demonstrate safety procedures and appropriate behavior while working in the agriculture
classroom, labs, and/or work sites.

4487F7451505440DAA9F1CA6F4B44066.description: Discuss the importance of safety in agricultural occupations.

2724BBE9566E443E863F6898BDA0A4A7.description: Select safety equipment and procedures for various agriculture related activities.

26074F7A83EE41108A2F07EC824A23FC.description: Identify hazards in agricultural education labs and work sites.

E4F8F563851842E1B7CBD44AE104C580.description: Determine and illustrate safety in the agriculture lab and agriculture worksites.

5B6225650D844D27B41C30260578318D.description:
Identify the top three agricultural commodities within each region of the United States and
the world.

63AD579A104C49828D8D633762D6B66E.description:
Compare and contrast between agricultural products and byproducts and lists examples of
each.

88ED1EBF940A453992B6C2FDCDFFDCEB.description: Differentiate between agricultural imports and exports and list examples of each.

A94026DA41F34715A79DE59D2A2024DA.description: Describe the eight major branches of the agriculture industry.

D1CD7CBD729A4051A1A7EFC2EC1C8568.description:
Identify major agricultural milestones or inventions and analyzes their impact on modern
life and agriculture.

03F20B619BF2449F9A43DC8ACCF57F02.description: Explain the three basic human needs and sources for food, clothing, and shelter.

BF48A18A802541C88A3D2BB1BE980693.description: Recognize how agriculture meets human needs today, in the past, and for the future.

0C4D3243088541B5AF0E3BC11A3F4A1B.description:
Analyze skills, education requirements, income, and advantages and disadvantages of
careers in the agriculture industry.

76B44A64BE2246EA87FCCD8B039B8AEE.description:
Define agribusiness terminology and discuss the role of marketing in agricultural
production.

5B573E3832E148148A1068A5C495C086.description:
Explain the role of the different types of agribusiness in society and identify agribusinesses
in the local community.

B832FC76DEF44689AD18F19415F70589.description: Demonstrate employability skills such as work ethic, timeliness, communication, and selfdirection.

6D6120F2FDD84BE5B7A126A124EF6C26.description:
Design, implement, and document SAE by recording steps, skills acquired, and financial
information.

1518A5D235024531A748581B00E415FC.description:
Explore, develop, and implement the Supervised Agricultural Experience (SAE) program by
researching careers in agriculture and agribusiness.

FEBA124CE3AD42B995B98888F126DDB2.description:
Design personal leadership plan that includes opportunities for personal development
through student, chapter, and community related activities.

91E17657C0CC4D49BA522C6552E8EE58.description:
Demonstrate communication skills individually and within group situations by using public
speaking skills and parliamentary procedure abilities.

8009BBEB1D8E4E839B84C14AB6F0A8D5.description:
Interpret basic FFA information such as the emblem, colors, motto, mission, salute,
behavior, and official dress.

2C3A7BBCFDA544379472F5C34500EFEE.description:
Illustrate the relationship of the FFA within the Agricultural Education model and describe
the role and function of the organizational structure from the chapter to national level.

51A3FC31AC99495B8E42F1DA2D2BB9E3.description:
Summarize the FFA history including a basic timeline of events, key people, and major
historical occurrences of the organization.

95B9CA7F3DA44448B98423EC5633895E.description: Relate the role of the FFA student organization in the students’ personal development.

1E28AC8D1A3E4D0EA57DA70C8ECEC5F7.description: Present a professional image through appearance, behavior and language.

206527F347E44CCE9722C606634A0501.description:
Apply the appropriate skill sets to be productive in a changing, technological, diverse workplace to
be able to work independently and apply team work skills.

5FF04084D4F54B55AAEE59FE40A2C2C9.description:
Model work readiness traits required for success in the workplace including integrity, honesty,
accountability, punctuality, time management, and respect for diversity.

34B6E42E9BE4405EB4567CD2FE9DA8E1.description:
Exhibit critical thinking and problem solving skills to locate, analyze and apply information in
career planning and employment situations.

C4C83E5379F64C7C9A7D2CB864F43B78.description:
Demonstrate creativity by asking challenging questions and applying innovative procedures and
methods.

BCE9E5AC4CCD4B85AE07D6C70F6B3D2C.description: Communicate effectively through writing, speaking, listening, reading, and interpersonal abilities.

8C1D94176E26448F9CC2EFC8BE1E8F07.description: Demonstrate employability skills required by business and industry.
